basics.name: Kayla Hirano
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

work.summary: Created the backend API for a mobile app using C# and .NET 6.0 Framework.
highlights: Gained experience in API development and working with Azure resources
Collaborated with other interns and FTEs.

work.summary: Developed a GPS sensor as part of current company project.
highlights: Worked with Python, ZeroMQ, and SQL.
Gained experience soldering and reading data from Raspberry Pi.

work.summary: On the development team of the Manoa Now mobile app.
highlights: Developed with JavaScript and React Native.
Recently updated the in-app map, enabling users to view important locations on campus.

awards.title: University of Hawaii Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: The highest level merit scholarship awarded to approximately 20 students per matriculating class.
